<<<<<<< HEAD
An elegy in commemoration of the Right Worshipful Sir William Scroggs, late lord chief justice of His Majesties Court of Kings-Bench, who departed this life, the 25th of this instant October. 1683.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed by J. Grantham, London: : in the year, MDCLXXXIII. [1683]
Verse: "Thou pleasing muse, who late did'st gay appear ..." Imperfect: stained, affecting text and imprint. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
